B. Confusion Matrix Analysis

A confusion matrix was created for each model.

For the Random Forest model, most of the classes were

predicted correctly with very few false negatives,

showing it works well across different disease types.

The Logistic Regression model had trouble

distinguishing between similar symptoms. The Decision

Tree model had issues with predicting rare diseases

accurately.

Support Vector Machine (SVM). The dataset was split

into 80% for training and 20% for testing, using a method

called stratified sampling. To deal with the imbalance in

the classes, the Synthetic Minority Over-sampling

Technique (SMOTE) was used. Model settings were

adjusted using grid search and cross-validation to

improve performance.
